trans-unit.source: Add authentication on Android with Mobile Apps| Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Add authentication on Android with Mobile Apps| Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Apps in Azure App Service to authenticate users of your Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Apps in Azure App Service to authenticate users of your Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Android app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Android app

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the todolist quickstart project on Android using a supported identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the todolist quickstart project on Android using a supported identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial, which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial, which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps], then from the **Run** menu click **Run app** and verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps], then from the **Run** menu click **Run app** and verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access the backend as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access the backend as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Cache authentication tokens on the client
trans-unit.target: Cache authentication tokens on the client

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you completed this basic authentication tutorial, consider continuing on to one of the following tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Now that you completed this basic authentication tutorial, consider continuing on to one of the following tutorials:

trans-unit.source: [Add push notifications to your Android app](app-service-mobile-android-get-started-push.md)
trans-unit.target: [Add push notifications to your Android app](app-service-mobile-android-get-started-push.md)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add push notifications support to your app and configure your Mobile App backend to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add push notifications support to your app and configure your Mobile App backend to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Enable offline sync for your Android app
trans-unit.target: Enable offline sync for your Android app

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add offline support your app using an Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add offline support your app using an Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.
